result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey Borrego was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Wright County Minnesota Case 86-CR-17502

2:35  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 1 of the information to be filed today.    Facts are correct    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1 of the information which will be filed today. 2:34  Defendant Casey  Borrego in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Casey  Borrego in custody.  Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wants to waive the preliminay hearing. Judge exams the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary hearing. Court approves the waiver of prelim and binds the defendat over.

Prior: 1101 Elaina Lane, Faribault, MN 55021 United States
Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
The Court reviews the bond conditions with the defendant. Court verifies the DOB, address and phone # with the defendant.

03:18 Defendant Casey  Borrego in court, in custody VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ. Atty McMullen appears via phone for the defendant. Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich, defendant missed prelim, on detainer from MN requests $2000 cash bond. Atty McMullen requests $501 cash bond. Froelich agrees. Court orders $501 cash bond and quashes warrant. PDs office will be involved. Defendant has not been in the armed services. 03:28  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing at 03-08-2016 11:30 am

3:53 Defendant Casey Borrego in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Christopher Bub appeared in court via phone.   Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Thorie requests a cash bond, no ties to the community. Bub requests signature bond or an extremely low cash bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 11:30 am.
